title: Smartphone orientation tutorial
content: In this tutorial you will learn how to see by console the orientation of your smartphone on an axis.

Select **SmartphoneOrientation** to make your smartphone vibrate

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/SmartphoneOrientation-Item.png)

Scan the QR code with your smartphone.

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/qrscan.png)

Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open it locally.

Moves the following components to the workspace

the **orientation** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/smartphoneorientation/image.png)

and the **event** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/smartphoneorientation/event.png)

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Log/Log.png) on the sidebar,

move the **print** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Log/print.png)

and put the print and orientation components as in the image

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/smartphoneorientation/log.png)

this is to display by console a number representative of the orientation of your smartphone on the x-axis.

Put the components as in the image

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/smartphoneorientation/blocks.png)

this is to show by console the orientation of your smartphone in the x-axis every time there is a change in the orientation of your smartphone in the x-axis, or y-axis, or z-axis.
